Southwold Library

Manager: Charlotte Clark

North Green, Southwold
IP18 6AT

Tel: 01502 722519
Fax: 01502 722519
Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
Friends group: Friends of Southwold Library

Social media:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: on-street parking only
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Refreshments: hot drinks for sale
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • For sale:
    • Crafts, Southwold and Suffolk Coast Treasure Trails sheets.
    • Local authors' books.
    • Branded bags and pens.
  • Also available: laminating (up to A4), foodbank collection point all year round.

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow an iPad
  • Photocopying: available in colour and black and white up to A4 size
  • Colour printing: available up to A4 size
  • Scan to email
  • Fax
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday Closed
Tuesday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1800
Wednesday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1800
Thursday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1800
Friday 1000 – 1300, 1400 – 1800
Saturday 0930 – 1300, 1400 – 1700
Sunday 1100 – 1600

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Sunday, 1030-1100

Songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Tuesday, 1030-1100

Songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Lego Club

Sunday, 1215-1300

Open to children (and adults) of all ages. Help and donations of Lego appreciated.

Storytime: stories, crafts and colouring for children under 7 years old

Sunday, 1130-1215

Summer Reading Challenge

Summer Reading Challenge

Saturday 21 July - Sunday 2 September, opening hours

Talk to a volunteer about your latest read, borrow your next book and collect rewards for your Summer Reading Challenge progress.

Older people's events

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Tuesday, 1400-1530

last Wednesday of the month, 1930-2100

fourth Monday of the month, 1000-1200

Reading group

IT help

Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance

Language courses

French for improvers: for those with some previous learning

Monday, 1400-1530

£80 for a 10 week course starting 14 May. For more information or to book a place please contact the library or Helen at Waveney Languages Tuition on 07999033452 / waveneylanguages@hotmail.com. No session 21 or 28 May.

French for improvers: for those with some previous learning

Monday, 1400-1530

£80 for a 10 week course starting 17 September. For more information or to book a place please contact the library or Helen at Waveney Languages Tuition on 07999033452 / waveneylanguages@hotmail.com. No session 15 or 22 October.

German for beginners

Mondays from 17 September, 1200-1330

£80 for a ten-week course. Contact the library to book, pay at registration. No session 15 or 22 October.

Holiday Italian for beginners and the rusty

Mondays from 6 August, 1600-1800

£70 for a six-week course. Contact the library to book, pay at registration. Course will only run if 5 people or more book.

Games and conversation in Italian: for adults who already know some Italian

Mondays from 6 August, 1830-2030

£70 for a six-week course. Contact the library to book, pay at registration.

Arts, crafts & games

Mah-jong group

Second Thursday of every month, 1830

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

Trading Standards and fire safety information

second Tuesday of the month, 1030-1300
